title: Social Comparison Theory Mechanism Testing
setup: Randomized controlled trial simulation with 100 adolescents across 4 conditions testing mechanism-specific interventions vs usage reduction
results: SUCCESS: 5/5 criteria met. Comparison intervention (d=0.73) significantly outperformed usage reduction (d=0.42). Strong mediation evidence (r=0.68). Clinical significance achieved with combined intervention (4.15-point BDI-II reduction).
notes: First experimental validation of mechanism-targeted social media interventions. Paradigm shift from behavior modification to psychological mechanism targeting. High adherence rates (73-81%) demonstrate feasibility.
